Container.Name: Kokoro-FastAPI-GPU
Container.Overview:
Kokoro-FastAPI is a Dockerized FastAPI wrapper for the Kokoro-82M text-to-speech model, optimized for speed and quality.[br][br]
[b]Features:[/b][br] - High-quality Japanese and English text-to-speech.[br] - Accelerated inference using NVIDIA GPUs.[br] - OpenAI-compatible speech endpoint.[br] [br] [b]Home Assistant Integration:[/b][br] This container is fully compatible with the [b]OpenAI TTS[/b] integration in Home Assistant. You can generate local, OpenAI-level quality voice audio using your own GPU.[br] 1. Install the OpenAI TTS integration (via HACS).[br] 2. Set the "API Key" to any random text (e.g., "123").[br] 3. Set the "Target URL" to: [b]http://[IP]:8880/v1[/b][br] [br] [b]Requirements:[/b][br] - Requires the [b]Nvidia Driver[/b] plugin.[br] - This container runs as internal user [b]1001[/b]. Ensure your "Temp Files" output directory is writable by this user.[br] - The WebUI is located at [b]/web[/b].

Config.Name: Temp Files (Audio Output)
Config.Description: Directory where generated audio files are saved. MUST be writable by UID 1001.

Config.Name: NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES
Config.Description: GPU UUID to pass to the container (or 'all').
